content.description: Sit start on the right, make a big move left and find a hook around the right side, then continue to compress you’re way to the top of the boulder.
content.location: Just off the ‘path’ on the left side as you walk down towards the cliff. Sit start on the right side.

content.description: Start on cone-shaped outcropping in the center of the boulder. Start up the face using good diagonal cracks and crimps for holds, you can work right (easier) or make a big move to the top on bad feet but decent hands.
content.location: Near the boulder cave, practically the center of the cliff. Boulder is very prominent and hard to miss.

content.description: This section is for the boulders scattered along the base of Butter Cliffs. Most of the problems are either on small cliff- bands or from blocks that have fractured off from the cliffs themselves. The main attraction is a house sized boulder (you can’t miss it) and a 20 ft Boulder cave under the ‘Cave of The Meadowood’, but there are also many other smaller boulders/cliffs that have challenging problems that are worth the trip.
